brewery.brewery_description:
Brains is Wales’ most famous drink. It is the toast of a nation.

Still owned by the descendants of the founders that took over a fledgling brewery in a small stone building behind a Cardiff pub in 1882. 

Brewed at The Cardiff Brewery, Brains' award-winning beers are now widely available across Wales and can increasingly be found in supermarkets and pubs throughout the rest of Britain.

beer.beer_description:
The Rev. James Original is rich and well-balanced with a mellow malty flavour that unexpectedly gives way to a clean, refreshing finish.

The Rev. James ales are based on an original recipe from 1885, and named in honour of brewing legend the Rev. James Buckley, saver of souls and satisfier of thirsts.

Brewed with our exclusive Buckleys yeast, they each deliver a signature taste with a surprising finish.

items.badge_description: It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That’s 20 check-ins with a photo.
99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 10 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 3!
Travel much? You must be a "brewsetter". That's at least a beer from 10 different countries. Try 5 more for Level 3!

The Rev. James ales are based on an original recipe from 1885, and named in honour of brewing legend the Rev. James Buckley, saver of souls and satisfier of thirsts.

Brewed with our exclusive Buckleys yeast, they each deliver a signature taste with a surprising finish.

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 150 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 31!

The Rev. James ales are based on an original recipe from 1885, and named in honour of brewing legend the Rev. James Buckley, saver of souls and satisfier of thirsts.

Brewed with our exclusive Buckleys yeast, they each deliver a signature taste with a surprising finish.

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 95 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 20!

beer.beer_description:
Treacle-coloured with a creamy contrasting head. A velvety smooth pint, Dark has a combination of chocolate, crystal and brown malts providing a clean palate with hints of liquorice and freshly ground coffee.

Once called Red Dragon the famous pint of Dark has always been synonymous with Brains particularly in Cardiff with the dock-workers of old, the male voice choirs and with rugby fans down in the Arms Park. Nowadays its popularity has expanded and is the biggest selling dark mild in Wales, continually winning awards both nationally and internationally.

Cask ABV: 3.5%
Bottle ABV: 4.1%

items.badge_description: While small, the brewing tradition of Wales is quite robust. As early as the 6th century the country began to form its very own distinct styles. That's 10 different beers from a brewery from Wales. Try 5 more for Level 3!

beer.beer_description:
The Rev. James Original is rich and well-balanced with a mellow malty flavour that unexpectedly gives way to a clean, refreshing finish.

The Rev. James ales are based on an original recipe from 1885, and named in honour of brewing legend the Rev. James Buckley, saver of souls and satisfier of thirsts.

Brewed with our exclusive Buckleys yeast, they each deliver a signature taste with a surprising finish.

items.badge_description: Whether you’re feeling extra special or extra strong, stopping by the local pub for a delicious Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter is always a good decision! That's 90 different beers with the style of Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter. Try 5 more for Level 19!

beer.beer_description:
The famous ‘pint of Brains’ is rich amber coloured, well balanced and refreshing. Goldings and Fuggles hops from The Welsh Marches create an appetising crisp aroma to complement the subtle flavour of fine pale malt. Crystal clear water combines with the unique Brains yeast to create the complete Welsh beer experience.

Cask ABV: 3.7%
Can ABV: 3.5%

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 210 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 43!

items.checkin_comment: Malty ruby ale, rich and sweet with a bitter finish. Kept its head too right til the end.

beer.beer_description:
The Rev. James Original is rich and well-balanced with a mellow malty flavour that unexpectedly gives way to a clean, refreshing finish.

The Rev. James ales are based on an original recipe from 1885, and named in honour of brewing legend the Rev. James Buckley, saver of souls and satisfier of thirsts.

Brewed with our exclusive Buckleys yeast, they each deliver a signature taste with a surprising finish.

items.badge_description: Traveling the world is hard, but not for you. It's as easy as cracking open a new brew! You have had a beer from at least 125 different regions around the world. Try 5 more for Level 26!

Dispensed traditionally by hand pump, cask beers are best served at 55°F. This temperature allows all of the flavor nuances to emerge and permits appreciation of the often unfiltered texture. That's 250 checkins with the serving style of Cask! Try 5 more for Level 51!

While small, the brewing tradition of Wales is quite robust. As early as the 6th century the country began to form its very own distinct styles. That's 5 different beers from a brewery from Wales. Try 5 more for Level 2!

beer.beer_description:
The renowned ‘special ale’ is copper coloured with a full premium quality flavour. A nutty richness derived from a blend of fine pale and crystal malts is balanced with a satisfying dryness from the unique use of three hops: Challenger, Goldings and Fuggles. The aroma has a hint of spirit which adds to the legendary mystique of this premium cask beer.

In the mid-1950’s Brains introduced SA Best Bitter. This was quickly shortened to the easier bar call of SA and has become one of our most famous beers recognised throughout the country and further a field. SA is now over 50 years old which is a testament to its popularity.

items.badge_description: Your quest to quench your thirst leaves no stone unturned! That's at least 40 distinct venues!

Dispensed traditionally by hand pump, cask beers are best served at 55°F. This temperature allows all of the flavor nuances to emerge and permits appreciation of the often unfiltered texture. That's 30 checkins with the serving style of Cask! Try 5 more for Level 7!

Whether you’re feeling extra special or extra strong, stopping by the local pub for a delicious Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter is always a good decision! That's 10 different beers with the style of Extra Special / Strong Bitter or English Bitter. Try 5 more for Level 3!

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 45 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 10!

Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 30 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 7!

beer.beer_description:
Formerly part of the Brains Craft range.

Created by Simon Martin, aka Mr Real Ale Guide, this India Pale Ale was inspired by the ‘IPA revolution’ across the pond. The boy from Barry has used a trio of hops from the US in this pale coloured ale, which is bursting with citrus aromas. A unique smooth malt taste upfront is finished off by a vigorous bitterness and a ‘tidy’ clout of citrus and berry hop flavours.

items.badge_description: Canning is all the rage and it's not hard to see why - travels well, more environmentally friendly, and no need to carry your bottle opener. That's 10 checkins with the serving style of Can. Try 5 more for Level 3! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

beer.beer_description:
The Rev. James Original is rich and well-balanced with a mellow malty flavour that unexpectedly gives way to a clean, refreshing finish.

The Rev. James ales are based on an original recipe from 1885, and named in honour of brewing legend the Rev. James Buckley, saver of souls and satisfier of thirsts.

Brewed with our exclusive Buckleys yeast, they each deliver a signature taste with a surprising finish.

The renowned ‘special ale’ is copper coloured with a full premium quality flavour. A nutty richness derived from a blend of fine pale and crystal malts is balanced with a satisfying dryness from the unique use of three hops: Challenger, Goldings and Fuggles. The aroma has a hint of spirit which adds to the legendary mystique of this premium cask beer.

In the mid-1950’s Brains introduced SA Best Bitter. This was quickly shortened to the easier bar call of SA and has become one of our most famous beers recognised throughout the country and further a field. SA is now over 50 years old which is a testament to its popularity.

The Rev. James ales are based on an original recipe from 1885, and named in honour of brewing legend the Rev. James Buckley, saver of souls and satisfier of thirsts.

Brewed with our exclusive Buckleys yeast, they each deliver a signature taste with a surprising finish.

The Rev. James Original is rich and well-balanced with a mellow malty flavour that unexpectedly gives way to a clean, refreshing finish.

The Rev. James ales are based on an original recipe from 1885, and named in honour of brewing legend the Rev. James Buckley, saver of souls and satisfier of thirsts.

Brewed with our exclusive Buckleys yeast, they each deliver a signature taste with a surprising finish.

The renowned ‘special ale’ is copper coloured with a full premium quality flavour. A nutty richness derived from a blend of fine pale and crystal malts is balanced with a satisfying dryness from the unique use of three hops: Challenger, Goldings and Fuggles. The aroma has a hint of spirit which adds to the legendary mystique of this premium cask beer.

In the mid-1950’s Brains introduced SA Best Bitter. This was quickly shortened to the easier bar call of SA and has become one of our most famous beers recognised throughout the country and further a field. SA is now over 50 years old which is a testament to its popularity.

Formerly part of the Brains Craft range.

Created by Simon Martin, aka Mr Real Ale Guide, this India Pale Ale was inspired by the ‘IPA revolution’ across the pond. The boy from Barry has used a trio of hops from the US in this pale coloured ale, which is bursting with citrus aromas. A unique smooth malt taste upfront is finished off by a vigorous bitterness and a ‘tidy’ clout of citrus and berry hop flavours.

SA Gold is a full-flavoured, hoppy and refreshing golden ale. Careful use of hops creates a satisfying bitterness, perfectly balanced by vibrant citrus aromas and complex hop flavours from late-hopping using Cascade and Styrian Goldings. A deliciously satisfying and refreshing pint!

Cask ABV: 4.3%
Bottle/Can ABV: 4.7%

Treacle-coloured with a creamy contrasting head. A velvety smooth pint, Dark has a combination of chocolate, crystal and brown malts providing a clean palate with hints of liquorice and freshly ground coffee.

Once called Red Dragon the famous pint of Dark has always been synonymous with Brains particularly in Cardiff with the dock-workers of old, the male voice choirs and with rugby fans down in the Arms Park. Nowadays its popularity has expanded and is the biggest selling dark mild in Wales, continually winning awards both nationally and internationally.

Cask ABV: 3.5%
Bottle ABV: 4.1%
This finest Welsh stout has a bitterness and a distinctive dark malt flavour that is instantly recognisable as a true reflection of this style of beer.

The Rev. James Gold is crisp and sweet with fresh fruit flavours that are balanced by an intriguing depth and a light malty aroma.

The Rev. James ales are based on an original recipe from 1885, and named in honour of brewing legend the Rev. James Buckley, saver of souls and satisfier of thirsts.

Brewed with our exclusive Buckleys yeast, they each deliver a signature taste with a surprising finish.

The famous ‘pint of Brains’ is rich amber coloured, well balanced and refreshing. Goldings and Fuggles hops from The Welsh Marches create an appetising crisp aroma to complement the subtle flavour of fine pale malt. Crystal clear water combines with the unique Brains yeast to create the complete Welsh beer experience.

Cask ABV: 3.7%
Can ABV: 3.5%

The Rev. James Rye is dark, dry and distinctive, brewed for a full flavour and bitter finish with unexpected glimpses of citrus and spice.

The Rev. James ales are based on an original recipe from 1885, and named in honour of brewing legend the Rev. James Buckley, saver of souls and satisfier of thirsts.

Brewed with our exclusive Buckleys yeast, they each deliver a signature taste with a surprising twist.
A light, easy drinking beer, Brains Smooth is the preferred pint of the Welsh drinker!

A traditional cask ale with a distinctive reddish hue and hop aroma, finely balanced by a more-ish fruit finish.

Named to embody the spirit and passion of the Welsh nation, Bread of Heaven was hand crafted to celebrate Brains’ sponsorship of the Welsh national rugby team, and is the proud Official Ale of the Welsh Rugby Union.

Brewed in collaboration with Welsh rock band Stereophonics in celebration of their multi-million selling album 'Keep the Village Alive'.
Phonics is a vibrant pale ale with complex citrus, fruit and floral hop character with sweet biscuit and caramel malt flavours, balanced with a crisp bitter finish.
The new addition to our favourite Rev. James family of ales. Featuring fruity citrus flavours, this pale ale is vibrant and refreshing. Enjoy a clean bitterness and a smooth finish.

Keeping thirst at bay, of lager lovers across Wales and beyond…
Bayside Welsh lager inspired by the great lagers of the world and proudly brewed in the heart of Cardiff to 4.3% ABV!

This crisp, light, highly drinkable lager will set sail on 3rd Aug 2020 and we are delighted to welcome our new hero to the family. It will make a great addition to the already award-winning Brains Beer Brand.
An ale full of rich flavours for the festive period. Brewed using Aromatic Malt and bursting with a medley of spicy hop flavours, Fir King Good is a deep amber coloured ale with a warming finish.

Dark copper in colour, smells rich & fruity, tastes malty & satisfying.
Red Dragon is a limited edition celebration ale brewed to celebrate the opening of the new Dragon Brewery.
A traditionally brewed ale with a delicate blend of hop varieties balanced with carefully selected malt varieties. A refreshing drink that is soft on the palate.

A combination of six malts, Fuggles and Mosaic hops, and a blend of spices, black treacle and laverbread from the Welsh coast creates a beer dark chestnut in colour. It has aromas of mulled spice, orange and mango, and sweetness from the treacle that complements the warmth from the cloves, nutmeg, cinnamon, ginger and chilli.
Named after the Patron Saint of Wales, and Brewed specially to celebrate St.David's Day on March 1st. A light and thirst quenching ale. Dry hopped with Styrian Goldings hops.

Open Casket is deep-red, full-bodied and gives a reviving bite. Cara Red and Cara Hell Malts offer a deep saturated colour and rousing malt aroma. With just a touch of Midnight Wheat, it is rich in flavour, hopped with Bramling Cross for a spicy sensation.
A unique product that is easy-drinking and exceptionally smooth.

Coppers Reserve is a premium strong ale brewed with the finest pale ale and three types of Crystal malt. Matured with Penderyn whisky infused toasted oak chips, this distinctly warming ale has sweet caramel and light roasted flavours with hints of vanilla and honey. Late additions of fuggles and goldings hops give a balance bitterness and classic floral aromas. 
This is a 6% strong ale version brewed by Brains, not the same as the 10% barley wine previously brewed by Brains Craft Brewery subsidiary.
A pint worth savouring.

A hoppy blonde ale brewed with pale ale and lager malts, and Citra, Amarillo, Mosaic and Summer hops. A burst of tropical fruit aromas leads to flavours of peach and sweet grapefruit to produce a refreshing beer with a balanced bitterness.
